description:
Manual games allow you to set custom check locations and custom item names that will be rolled into a multiworld.
This allows any variety of game -- PC, console, board games, Microsoft Word memes... really anything -- to be part of a multiworld randomizer.
The key component to including these games is some level of manual restriction. Since the items are not actually withheld from the player,
the player must manually refrain from using these gathered items until the tracker shows that they have been acquired or sent.

v0.1.0.description:
This is the initial release of the world. As of yet, there's still a lot of cleaning up the code and changes to make, and the actual game mod doesn't exist yet.
Included is the .apworld, the default template .yaml, and a manual .apworld for use with the [Manual Client](https://github.com/ManualForArchipelago/Manual/releases/tag/manual_stable_20240709).

Place the .apworld(s) in your Archipelago/custom_worlds/ folder, place .yamls in the /Players/ folder, and generate.

To change the player name for the Manual world, you can edit the files directly or upload it to [Manual Builder](https://manualforarchipelago.github.io/ManualBuilder/) and change it there.
v0.1.0.title: Initial Release
